item.title: Borderlands 4's Best Gameplay Mods To Download
item.description:
Borderlands 4 is finally here, and fans across the globe are jumping in to take on the vaults and, of course, pick up thousands of weapons along the way. Performance issues aside, the game has been pretty well-received across the board, but like any modern PC game, the community is always hard at work to try and make things even better.

Sometimes it is nice to have some quality of life changes that make the general loop more enjoyable, while other mods completely break how the game is played on a fundamental level. Whatever the case, there are already quite a few handy mods for BL4 that players can download to improve an already incredibly fun shooter.

Full Map Unlock

Everything At The Click Of A Button

  • Created By: xKangoku (Link)

One of the toughest parts about BL4 is navigating the map. The areas are huge, and it can be hard to know where certain collectibles or hidden areas are, especially when they haven't even appeared on the map. Well, this handy mod helps with that immensely, removing all the fog and revealing the map, whilst also keeping everything locked so that players can still venture out and experience things for themselves.

What makes the mod so great is the simplicity and lack of overbearing changes it makes. Players can quite easily forget that they ever installed it, but by having it there, it makes exploring the map just a bit more enjoyable, particularly for players who really like to see and do everything there is.

Faster Rides

Getting Around The Huge Map Easier

  • Created By: Caites (Link)

The digirunner is one of the more fun elements of the game, allowing players to traverse huge areas in no time thanks to the speed and mobility the vehicle provides. However, with such a large map to cover, sometimes the gaps can get quite lengthy, which makes this mod a great addition to any player's playthrough.

It does exactly what it says on the tin, increasing the speed of the hoverbikes by a significant amount, both when boosting and while driving normally, but it also removes the speed cap, allowing players to reach insane speeds when given enough time to accelerate. It is restricted to the original bike, but that tradeoff is well worth the added speed to the player's journeys.

Better Moves

Stylish And Functional

  • Created By: Caites (Link)

Better Moves turns the player into a mobile killing machine, even more than they already were. Players already have access to some pretty insane movement options thanks to the new dash and slide combos, but this mod takes things further, adding additional speed and distance to every single move.

This makes certain areas a whole lot more enjoyable to traverse, as gaps can suddenly be cleared and enemies have a much harder time hitting the player thanks to the additional speed. It might take some getting used to, but once it has been experienced, players will never want to go back.

Difficulty And Loot Tweaks

Sliders, Toggles, Modifiers, And More

  • Created By: Caites (Link)

Difficulty And Loot Tweaks is a pretty nice mod that allows players to play with quite a few different stats to change how the game is played in a big way. Anything from damage dealt to cash gained, to loot quality can be adjusted through several difficulty settings, giving players the chance to play around and find a balance that suits them best.

It isn't just limited to making things easier either, as the mod has a few settings that actually make the game harder by increasing the damage the player takes, whilst upping the loot luck to compensate. Overall, it is a nice settings mod that can make subsequent playthroughs more enjoyable than just the UVH mechanic.

Gear n Gun Editor

Crafting The Perfect Arsenal

  • Created By: Awzam (Link)

Gear n Gun Editor is a simple yet powerful mod that takes the concept of a game that has over a billion guns and allows players to effectively circumvent the RNG steps and craft the perfect gun. Players can change the stats, rarity, and every other aspect of the weapon, all by using a single external client.

While it might be true that it removes some of the fun factor that comes from randomly getting a super good gun, it does allow players to access specific combinations that they may never find in the wild, letting them become true unstoppable forces with nothing to stand in their way.

MinimalHUD

Cleaning Up The Gameplay Experience

  • Created By: cartiblu (Link)

There are quite a few HUD mods out there that alter how the game appears from a visual perspective, but a lot of them focus on performance rather than tweaking actual mechanics. This mod goes further and gives players the tools to scale their HUD however they choose, keeping the emphasis on shooting as was intended.

There are scaling options to reduce the size of things in general, and a few other nice settings that hide certain popups like XP, to make the game feel more immersive and to give players an overall more enjoyable experience that doesn't feel cluttered with extra noise.

Builds

Jumping Straight Into The Deep End

  • Links: Shotgun, Harlowe, Vex

Some of the best mods available for BL4 are actually the simplest, and there are a few options out there for players who just want to be able to try out a super-powerful build that another player has stumbled upon.

Players have access to late-game builds that tear through anything, or even some earlier ones that can help them clear out the campaign without any struggles, which can make the hunt for the perfect weapon feel a lot less tedious when that weapon is already in the player's possession.

Borderlands 4
8 /10
21
7.8 /10
Released

item.title: World of Warcraft Brings Back Brewfest With Incredible New Rewards and Activities
item.description:
Brewfest has returned to World of Warcraft once again, but this time, fans can participate in the Brewfest Banquet Outdoor Scenario, complete fun questlines in Khaz Algar, and obtain excellent new rewards. The Dark Iron’s Ceremonial Set transmog, Brewfest Barrel Bomber mount, and the Brewer’s Balloon are just some of the fantastic items that players can obtain during Brewfest in World of Warcraft this year, which is live now through October 9.

In World of Warcraft , Brewfest is the in-gem analogue to Oktoberfest, a German beer celebration known as the largest Volksfest in the world. In Azeroth, it manifests as a two-week holiday event featuring alcoholic activities and booze-themed rewards.

What’s New With Brewfest 2025 in World of Warcraft?

This year, Brewfest is back in World of Warcraft in a big way. While Blizzard usually adds a new reward or two each year, this holiday refresh included over a half-dozen. The Dark Iron’s Ceremonial Set, which is a black and orange recolor of the Dwarf transmogs from World of Warcraft ’s September Trading Post, is available in exchange for Brewfest Prize Tokens alongside black and green Brewer’s kilts and berets, the Barrel Helm, and the Brewer’s Balloon toy. A new mount called the Brewfest Barrel Bomber has a small chance to drop from the Coren Direbrew encounter on the first kill per account each day, and a blue tint of the Brewer’s set can be obtained from the Brewfest Banquet Outdoor Scenario.

  • New Rewards
    • Brewfest Barrel Bomber (Drops from Coren Direbrew)
    • Brewer's Blue Set (Brewfest Banquet)
    • Brewer's Black Set (750 Brewfest Prize Tokens)
    • Brewer's Green Set (750 Brewfest Prize Tokens)
    • Dark Iron's Ceremonial Set (1300 Brewfest Prize Tokens)
    • Barrel Helm (200 Brewfest Prize Tokens)
    • Brewer's Balloon toy (200 Brewfest Prize Tokens)

  • New Activities
    • Brewfest Banquet Outdoor Scenario
    • Quests in Khaz Algar

This Brewfest Banquet is similar in many ways to other open world activities in World of Warcraft , such as the Community Feast soup-making event from Dragonflight or the Theater Troupe from The War Within . Fans can gather materials for the kitchen by defeating mobs, cook up pretzels, soup, or brew, or serve NPCs with these tasty treats in order to score points alongside other players. Were that not enough, new quests in Khaz Algar provide even more Brewfest merriment for fans to enjoy.

All previous Brewfest activities, from ram racing to barrel rolling, are still available, as are old Brewfest rewards and achievements in World of Warcraft , ensuring players can still get the most out of the holiday. The event goes live with regional weekly resets starting September 23, and will be live through October 9.

The holiday event is not only a great way for fans to fill out their Traveler’s Logs for September and October, but also to pass the time until Patch 11.2.5. The exciting update, which kicks off World of Warcraft: Legion Remix , arrives October 7, just a few days before Brewfest leaves town until next year.

World of Warcraft: Midnight

item.title: Sonic Racing CrossWorlds: All Items, Explained
item.description:
As is the case with most kart racing games, players will pick up random items from boxes while racing in Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds . However, in the midst of a hectic race with drifting, flying, and laps in other worlds, it can be hard to know what these items do, especially for those with no previous experience of Sonic Racing games.

Therefore, this guide will explain what all the items in Sonic CrossWorlds do , show players how to use them , and also demonstrate how to avoid them when utilized by opponents.

How To Use Items In Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds

To use an item, press:

  • Xbox: LB
  • PlayStation: L1
  • PC: Q
  • Switch: L

Players can also use the Left Stick on some items to determine whether they go ahead or behind .

There is no way to switch between held items unless using the Inventory Swap Gadget , which will state the button. Normally, 2 items can be held at once, but the Inventory Plus Gadget increases this to 3.

All Normal Items In Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds

Boost

  • Gain a burst of speed.

For each blue wisp you have, you have one boost. Try to use these on straights , rather than corners. They can also be used off-road to cut corners , as the slower terrain doesn't matter when boosting.

Triple Boost

  • Gain a burst of speed. Can be used three times, and the final burst is the strongest.

Try to save the final burst , depicted by a crown, to cut a large corner .

Laser

  • Transform into a laser to dash forward along the charted path and pass Machines ahead.

Try to end it on a sharp curve , as the game doesn't want to drop you here. Instead, it will extend the duration .

Drill

  • Transform into a drill. Move automatically toward the finish line.

This is essentially Bullet Bill from Mario Kart . Move aside when other players use it.

Monster Truck

  • Transform into a Monster Truck. Crush Machines in your path.

You are faster, larger, and immune to damage . Try to use it when surrounded by opponents. You can also hold it until an enemy projectile is inbound and use it defensively .

Omochao

  • Creates a path of Rings. Pick them up to accelerate.

Rings increase your max speed . You can also go off-road to use Omochao, as the rings dropped provide immunity .

Bonus Ring

  • Get the number of Rings shown in the icon.

Rings increase your maximum speed . These are found on the tracks rather than being obtained from item boxes. Make sure to aim for them .

Homing Punch

  • Fire an attack that locks onto the Machine ahead.

Homing Punch can also be thrown behind to hit opponents or deflect projectiles. This is similar to the Red Shell in Mario Kart .

Triple Homing Punch

  • Can use Homing Punch three times.

Don't spam them and try to save at least one for defense .

Rocket Punch

  • Fire an attack that fires straight and bounces off walls. Becomes a homing attack when locked onto a target.

Lock on with a red circle before firing. Rocket Punch is depicted by green boxing gloves .

Triple Rocket Punch

  • Can use Rocket Punch three times.

Try not to spam them and save one for defensive purposes .

Slicer

  • An attack that locks onto the Machine ahead, cuts it in half, and makes the racer drop an item.

Look for a red square over an opponent. This means it is locked and ready to be fired. Once sliced, a vehicle takes a few seconds to return to full speed.

Bomb

  • Fire a bomb that travels in a straight line. It gets bigger and stronger the longer it's held.

Try to use this on long straights and fully charge it. It's one of the least reliable items.

King Boom Boo

  • Summon King Boom Boo to attack the Machine in 1st place.

King Boom Boo flies in front of 1st place and fires a huge blue wave at them , spinning them around. This can hit other racers , so it's best used to take out a leading pack. It can only be prevented by the shield.

Slime

  • Block the vision of all other Machines, slow them down, and make them drop all items.

Consider using this as groups enter tricky stages of a track where vision is important. It could also be used after many players pick up items .

When hit with this, move the Left Stick in a circle to get rid of the slime . It is also deflected by the Tornado, Void, and Shield.

Weight

  • Drop weights on the machines in 1st and 2nd place, crushing them and making them drop 1 item.

This can be used from any distance. Weights can be deflected by the Shield and Tornado .

Dark Chao

  • Dark Chao forcibly grants items to all Machines. If they already have an item, a new item will be redrawn.

This includes the player who uses it , so if you have this and another item you don't like or no other item, you may as well use it and get new items .

Void

  • Sucks in Rings and item boxes from a distance. Negates some item attacks and course obstacles.

The void spawns around your machine .

Shield

  • Negates all attacks for a duration. Become harder to get knocked away when colliding with other Machines.

Similar to the gold star in Mario Kart . You are immune to everything and will push most other Machines away. Sometimes it should be held onto, especially in first place . Try to avoid others who have the Shield active.

Tornado

  • Create a tornado around the user, negating some incoming attacks. Deal damage to other Machines that come in contact while active.

Tornado stops all attacks apart from King Boom Boo. Try to avoid others who have a tornado around them.

Spiked Iron Ball

  • Place a road hazard that deals damage on contact.

It can be thrown ahead or behind and will block some projectiles close to the ground. It is similar to the bananas in Mario Kart ​​​​​. Try to leave this trap in chokepoints where players cannot go around and where there are no parallel tracks .

Magnet

  • Place a road hazard that draws in Machines around it.

It can be thrown ahead or behind . It will slow down players it catches.

The duration of items is lower the closer you get to the front. This prevents players from hoarding defensive items for too long.

Gadet-Only Items In Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds

Some items in Sonic CrossWorlds can only be obtained by equipping certain Gadgets . These are similar to perks and can change the way players race.

Other Gadgets improve some items , such as Giant Spiked Iron Ball.

Double Boost

  • Gain a burst of speed. Can be used twice.

The Double Boost is available at the start of the game with the Double Boost Specialist Gadget. Use it to get a head start. Double Boost will also appear in item boxes with this Gadget equipped.

Warp Ring

  • Warp to the Machine ahead and crush it.

This is available with the Warp Ring Specialist Gadget. Don't waste this by using on someone only slightly ahead , unless you are in 2nd place. Instead, try to take over a close opponent normally, then use it to jump to the next one. Warp Rings will also appear in item boxes when using this Gadget.

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds

item.title: Bungie's Marathon is Skipping the Next PlayStation State of Play
item.description:
Bungie isn't expected to reveal Marathon at Sony's September State of Play, with November being highly likely that the game could finally be shown off. It's been a long road for Marathon , one that has been frequented by delays, difficulties, and controversy. According to sources, the wait for a re-reveal could be a little bit longer than anticipated.

After numerous rumors, Sony finally confirmed a new State of Play event for PlayStation happening on September 24. The 35-minute presentation appears to be a mix of first and third party announcements, with Saros from Housemarque being the only game confirmed so far. The lack of details has led fans to speculate on which games could be showcased, though it seems one upcoming Sony first party game won't be shown either.

Marathon Not Expected To Be Shown at the September State of Play

Bungie's Marathon , an extraction shooter set within the franchise of the same name, is apparently not going to be showcased at the State of Play. The news comes from Paul Tassi, who reported that sources have indicated to him that Marathon not only won't be at the showcase, but there are currently no plans to release a blog or any other long-form style presentation before or after. Needless to say, fans will likely need to wait a while longer to see how Marathon has evolved from its previous closed alpha tests.

Speculation seems to point to a November reveal of some sort, which technically does align with Bungie's previous Marathon Development Update plans for a Fall announcement, even if it is probably a little later than fans were expecting. However, the extra time is likely being put to good use at Bungie if any of the recent leaks are to be believed. Playtesters, who are technically under NDA restrictions, have revealed substantial changes, including the Faction system being completely redesigned, new content being added, and other gameplay mechanics to name a few.

For many, Marathon still has a lot to prove ahead of its launch in 2026. Bungie's take on the extraction shooter genre left many players feeling underwhelmed during its closed testing phase, though that wasn't actually the biggest issue. Marathon has experienced a number of controversies during its lengthy development cycle, with none bigger than Bungie being accused of plagiarism. While initially praised, the art design and aesthetic were ripped from the work of an artist known as Antireal. Bungie has since delayed the game and reports indicate that the art in question has been scrubbed completely, leaving many to wonder what the game looks like now.

Marathon

From the creators of Halo and Destiny...

Scavenge the lost colony of Tau Ceti IV in Bungie’s team-based FPS extraction shooter. Choose your Runner and work together in crews of three as you battle rival teams and hostile security forces for weapons and upgrades. Survive and your loot is yours to keep for future runs on Tau Ceti—or if you’re brave enough, a journey to the derelict Marathon ship that hangs above.

Become a Runner:
Choose from a roster of cybernetic mercenaries with unique abilities. Customize your playstyle with the weapons, implants, and equipment you collect on your runs. Every match is a chance to experiment, buildcraft, and come back stronger.

Welcome to Tau Ceti IV:
What once was a thriving colony is now a battleground for rival factions competing for power and fortune, hiring Runners to track down weapons, valuables, and the edge they need to win.

Fun and competitive at all skill levels:
Bungie’s best-in-class first person gunplay makes playing at every skill level satisfying. With multiple maps to choose from, you can sharpen your skills in starter areas, then challenge yourself in high-stakes zones and Ranked mode in season one.

Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S

item.title: How to Use and Find the Key to Sakuko's Mailbox in Silent Hill f
item.description:
Aside from the various puzzles in Silent Hill f , players can also find collectibles and secrets that are usually hidden in the side paths. Most of these collectibles are notes or documents that players can read to get a bit more knowledge on the characters and story there. However, there are collectibles like keys that can lead to hidden charms and more resources. The guide below offers information on how players can acquire the key to Sakuko's Mailbox and where to use it in Silent Hill f .

It is best to use the key right away, as progress through the story might block off certain paths, making it impossible to access the path to the mailbox.

Where to Find the Key to Sakuko's Mailbox in Silent Hill f

During the second visit to Ebisugaoka , your objective will be to go to Rinko 's house. The house is to the far right, past the fields, but instead of taking that path, you can go north on the map to reach the Sennensugi Shrine . There shouldn't be any enemies as you make your way to the top of the shrine.

Once there, look to the left to spot the Key to Sakuko’s Mailbox and Letter from Sakuko's Mother . The letter gives you some insight into Sakuko's mother telling her daughter not to mention the weird voices she has been hearing to anyone.

How to Open Igarashi Residence's Mailbox in Silent Hill f

To use the key, you will have to make your way to Sukaku's house , which is located at the start of the area. You will have to backtrack all the way there , going past countless enemies along the way, so be cautious, especially on higher difficulties. Once you reach the Hokora , follow the road and turn left. At the end of the path, take a right and keep going until you reach the Chizuruya General Store . Take a right and follow this path to reach the area outside Sukaku's house.

There will be multiple enemies around the Mailbox , but you can dodge away from their attacks and interact with the Mailbox which will give you the Letter from the Hospital and Omamori [Spider] . This charm greatly decreases weapon durability consumption from performing Light Attacks which is great because most of the time you will have weapons with durability.

Players interested in finding out how to increase inventory space in Silent Hill f , can check out the guide here

10 /10

Silent Hill f
